function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Misunderstanding of cholera transmission and causes attributed to divine theory and miasma.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Persistent belief in miasma theory leading to stigmatization of urban poverty and unsanitary practices, contributing to the spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Proximity and crowding in urban areas leading to rapid spread of diseases from person to person.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of infrastructure for uncontaminated and treated drinking water leading to outbreaks of waterborne diseases such as cholera, typhoid, hepatitis, and polio.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Social practices and communities shaping the emergence and locations of epidemic outbreaks such as syphilis and hiv/aids in urban areas.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Historical evidence of urban strategies of containment and spatial distancing to combat disease since ancient times, prefiguring modern social distancing strategies.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Strategies involving the rejection or exclusion of people from cities or the imposition of controls upon the movements of entire populations as historical ways of exerting power in response to public health threats.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Airborne transmission of deadly diseases such as tuberculosis","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unhygienic living conditions and dense living spaces","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Obsession with hygiene by design leading to unintended consequences","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Association between disease outbreaks and urban governance","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"City confronted with earlier epidemics","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Cholera and yellow fever epidemics in buenos aires between 1867 and 1871","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited understanding of disease leading to development of military cantonments","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reshaping of rural landscape creating ideal habitats for disease vectors","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Disproportionate impact of pandemic on lower-caste hindu population","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of cure or vaccine for tuberculosis","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate environmental and behavioral interventions","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Hypochondriacal fears of europeans of catching diseases from native bodies such as malaria, cholera, and dysentery.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Miasma theories explaining disease as resultant from the bad air ’emanating directly from the earth due to heat and humidity.’","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Legacy of hypochondria in the development of housing for british colonizers in tropical places.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Neglect of informal settlements despite being characterized as degenerate and associated with social and contagious diseases.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Association of poverty, morality, and disease, leading to discriminatory urban planning and design decisions.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Use of ’surgical’ and brutal slum clearance operations in response to contagious diseases outbreaks.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Focussing on three very different cities -jerusalem, phnom penh and torontothey reveal how histories of colonial occupation and planning, of postcolonial economic modernization and of entrepreneurial planning geared to promoting competitive global cities have produced conditions germane to the uneven spread and impacts of covid-19.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Uneven distribution of health impacts in cities due to urban planning and interventions.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential for urban planning to be divisive in interpretations of appropriate spatial interventions, exacerbating social inequality.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Risk of transmission and spread of covid-19 and other pandemics in urban environments.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of sanitation and hygiene in victorian london","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate public health infrastructure in the past","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spread of covid-19 in crowded occupational environments","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Occupational exposure to coronavirus based on job tasks","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Workers at risk of exposure to sars-cov-2 in the workplace","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inability to eliminate covid-19 from the workplace","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited effectiveness of control measures","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation systems in the workplace","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Poorly ventilated indoor environments","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risk of airborne transmission of sars-cov-2 in indoor environments","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Covid-19 transmission in confined and crowded indoor spaces","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation in workplaces","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increasing the numbers of air exchanges","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Avoiding air recirculation","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Air recirculation can transport infectious contaminants through spaces, leading to the re-entry of virus particles into workstations.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Failure to close recirculation dampers can lead to the distribution of airborne contaminants from one point to others connected to the same system.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of induction units and fan coils with local circulation may lead to the resuspension of virus particles.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient outdoor airflow can contribute to the buildup of infectious contaminants in indoor spaces.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation leading to poor indoor air quality","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient social distancing among workers","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ineffective air filtration leading to airborne transmission of viruses within buildings","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Misconceptions about the effectiveness of hepa filters in capturing coronaviruses","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"}]}
